content:
DoubleAnimationUsingPath Class

Definition

Animates the value of a Double property between two or more target values using a PathGeometry to specify those values. This animation can be used to move a visual object along a path.

In this Article

public class DoubleAnimationUsingPath : System.Windows.Media.Animation.DoubleAnimationBase

Remarks

DoubleAnimationUsingPath uses linear interpolation over a specified Duration.

DoubleAnimationUsingPath is similar to DoubleAnimation except that it uses a PathGeometry to interpolate over two or more values rather then between only two values like DoubleAnimation. Although DoubleAnimation is used for most simple animations involving a Double value, DoubleAnimationUsingPath is particularly well suited for animating the position of an object on the screen.

Constructors

DoubleAnimationUsingPath()

Initializes a new instance of the DoubleAnimationUsingPath class.

public DoubleAnimationUsingPath ();

Remarks

There is no default PathGeometry so the user must specify one.

Fields

Properties

IsAdditive

Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the target property's current value should be added to this animation's starting value.

public bool IsAdditive { get; set; }
Value
Boolean

true if the target property's current value should be added to this animation's starting value; otherwise, false. The default value is false.

Remarks

Dependency Property Information
Identifier field IsAdditiveProperty
Metadata properties set to true None
Note

This dependency property is unusual in that the identifier field for it comes from AnimationTimeline, and is shared by various derived classes.

IsCumulative

Gets or sets a value that specifies whether the animation's value accumulates when it repeats.

public bool IsCumulative { get; set; }
Value
Boolean

true if the animation accumulates its values when its stem.Windows.Media.Animation.Timeline.RepeatBehavior* property causes it to repeat its simple duration. otherwise, false. The default value is false.

Remarks

When this property is set to true, the animation's output values only accumulate when the animation's RepeatBehavior property causes it to repeat its simple duration. It does not accumulate its values when it restarts because its parent repeated or because its clock was restarted from a Begin call.

Dependency Property Information
Identifier field IsCumulativeProperty
Metadata properties set to true None
Note

This dependency property is unusual in that the identifier field for it comes from AnimationTimeline, and is shared by various derived classes.

PathGeometry

Specifies the geometry used to generate this animation's output values.

public System.Windows.Media.PathGeometry PathGeometry { get; set; }
Value
PathGeometry

The path used to generate this animation's output values. The default value is null.

Remarks

In Extensible Application Markup Language (XAML), you can use a special abbreviated syntax to describe the path. 

This snippet ID doubleanimationusingpathattributesyntaxexample is used in multiple files: /CS/doubleanimationusingpathattributesyntaxexample.xaml, /xaml/doubleanimationusingpathattributesyntaxexample.xaml. Rename the duplicate ID to make it unique, and update the reference to the snippet ID in the topic(s).

This snippet ID doubleanimationusingpathattributesyntaxexample is used in multiple files: /CS/doubleanimationusingpathattributesyntaxexample.xaml, /xaml/doubleanimationusingpathattributesyntaxexample.xaml. Rename the duplicate ID to make it unique, and update the reference to the snippet ID in the topic(s).

For more information about PathGeometry markup syntax, see Path Markup Syntax. For more examples of creating a path using markup or code, see PathGeometry.

Methods

Clone()

Creates a modifiable clone of this DoubleAnimationUsingPath, making deep copies of this object's values. When copying dependency properties, this method copies resource references and data bindings (but they might no longer resolve) but not animations or their current values.

public System.Windows.Media.Animation.DoubleAnimationUsingPath Clone ();
Returns
DoubleAnimationUsingPath

A modifiable clone of the current object. The cloned object's stem.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen* property will be false even if the source's stem.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen* property was true.

Remarks

This method is used to produce modifiable copies of frozen Freezable objects (or any Freezable object). For convenience, this method shadows the inherited version with a strongly typed implementation.

For more information, see Clone.

CreateInstanceCore()

Implementation of stem.Windows.Freezable.CreateInstanceCore*.

protected override System.Windows.Freezable CreateInstanceCore ();
Returns
Freezable

The new Freezable created.

GetCurrentValueCore(Double,Double,AnimationClock)

Calculates a value that represents the current value of the property being animated, as determined by the DoubleAnimationUsingPath.

protected override double GetCurrentValueCore (double defaultOriginValue, double defaultDestinationValue, System.Windows.Media.Animation.AnimationClock animationClock);
defaultOriginValue
Double

The suggested origin value, used if the animation does not have its own explicitly set start value.

defaultDestinationValue
Double

The suggested destination value, used if the animation does not have its own explicitly set end value.

animationClock
AnimationClock

An AnimationClock that generates the stem.Windows.Media.Animation.Clock.CurrentTime* or stem.Windows.Media.Animation.Clock.CurrentProgress* used by the animation.

Returns
Double

The calculated value of the property, as determined by the current animation.

Remarks

If the defaultOriginValue is the first in the composition chain, this value will be the snapshot value (if one is available) or the base property value; otherwise this value will be the value returned by the previous animation in the chain with an AnimationClock that is not Stopped.

The defaultDestinationValue is the base value if the animation is in the first composition layer of animations on a property; otherwise the value is the output value from the previous composition layer of animations for the property.

OnChanged()

Called when this DoubleAnimationUsingPath is modified.

protected override void OnChanged ();
